attributes.action: allow road worthy vehicles of 25years and older a free road fund licence
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A previous government made provision for road worthy vehicles of 25years and older to recieve a free road fund licence disc.
This was in recognition that most older vehicles were usualy 'second' vehicles and so saw very little road use whilst being maintained usualy by enthusiasts to a higher standard than a family saloon.
One of the first things the 'new labour' government did was to stop the rolling 25 year programme at August 1973 - all vehicles after this pay the full cost whatever their age. I request that this be revoked and the 25year rolling programme be reinstated as intended.
